website_summaries.verdict: A solid controller for PC and Xbox that has a good wireless range, but some found the installation to be a little more hands-on than other options.
pros: Works with Windows 7, 8.1, and 10, as well as Xbox One
Wireless adapter supports up to 8 controllers at a time
cons: Controller is a little on the heavy side
Some buyers report issues getting this up and running
does not plug and play easily

customer_reviews.title: It works... But is older version.
customer_reviews.text: It works... but I'm kind of disappointed I received the older larger Xbox Wireless Adapter for Windows, even though in the pictures and description show/state the 33% smaller one. I believe that the controller is an older version as well, maybe a refurb hard to tell.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Krech

customer_reviews.title: Did not plug and play easily. The quick solution to get it running wirelessly ...
customer_reviews.text: Did not plug and play easily. The quick solution to get it running wirelessly is to go to the controller in Device Manager and choose the option to search and update driver from the internet. Other than that, the controller is awesome. Works great with Windows gaming. I don’t own an Xbox console, so I can’t review for that.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: come on microsoft step it up !!
customer_reviews.text: this is gettin ridiculous. all i want is a wireless controller for pc but microsoft makes sure you waste money for a product with a dead technology in it. bluetooth dont work. never has never will. i have never known anyone to have 100% reliability with anything bluetooth. this controller will not work for you if you are on a pc with an HDMI display. its ridiculous. apparently hdmi emmits a signal that interferes with bluetooth so expect constant disconnections in the middle of your game. go with a 3rd party wired controller as they wont lose connection. avoid steelseries BT controller as well as they are even worse.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Socks

customer_reviews.title: Severe stick drift
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used the controller, after connecting it to the PC, it was impossible not to notice the hefty stick drift. Every time I'd recenter from the upper-right, the cursor would stick, as if I were still moving the joystick in that direction. An issue that gets very frustrating. I've had stick drift happen to controllers in the past, but it usually doesn't start until I've owned the controller for years. This is the first time I've ever had it come in a controller right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: O. Albretsen

customer_reviews.title: Avoid for Windows 7
customer_reviews.text: It states it works with Windows 7. It does not, or at least in my experience. I followed the directions for plug-and-play. The drivers did not load. I looked online for solutions. A few were proposed but none worked. After updating every driver I could think of (including the controller file) and getting Windows up to date completely I gave up and requested a refund. If anyone has a sure-fire solution to get this to work with Windows 7 I would love to hear it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew G

customer_reviews.title: Works great with NVIDIA Shield TV
customer_reviews.text: I have not tried this on a PC but use is all the time on my Shield TV. I've been a fan of the Xbox controllers from back when I had my 360 and never really got a feel for the included shield controller. I wasn't sure if I would need the USB dongle or not but decided to go with this package just in case. Turns out the Shield can directly communicate with the controller over bluetooth without the adapter. That just means I can use the adapter on my pc for more casual gaming. Overall a big improvement for me on the Shield.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: The best gamepad for a PC
customer_reviews.text: I have a gaming PC hooked up to my TV for relaxing gaming (ie I'd rather using a wireless controller for convenience vs using a wired gaming mouse to get better performance). This lets me using the ubiquitous Xbox one controller wirelessly with my various games. Thus I can play Madden, Forza, FAr Cry etc... like I'm on a console, but with a 1080TI. Anyway, it's plug and play, and it works with any Xbox One controller. The dongle is much more compact that what they used to use, and performance is solid. Supposedly this won't work on WIndows 8 or 7. I cannot verify, but it works great on Windows 10 Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Shane O. Laake

customer_reviews.title: Update driver
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work the First time I tired to connect the controller to the adapter that it came with. Had to restart the computer with the adapter still in the usb for it to power up. Weird. A series of issues and internet searches revealed that these issues plague these controllers/adapters. But many of the issues seems to have been resolved once I updated the drivers. So far. The big one was the computer freezing whenever I had my headset plugged into the headphone jack and tried to use discord. That was making me very angry! Windows 10 user. Just FYI. Overall the feel of the controller is great. Responsive and comfy to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Dreamer

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed, good hand-feel, but took some finagling to connect to my Windows 10 PC
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box this controller looks great and well designed. It feels solid and has a weighty but not heavy feel--it's not just hollow plastic. Following instructions online I still had some trouble connecting to my PC. Holding down the sync button, sometimes it tries, sometimes it just stays in the disconnected state. I'm still giving it 5 stars though, because once connected it has worked seamlessly and reliably. Get this over the knockoffs. It is pricey for a controller, but it is the real deal and the knockoffs I've had don't compare.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer D

customer_reviews.title: Great controller for my pc, I'll be using the Xbox design labs for my master Xbox controller.
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to buy one of these - being a long time Sony fan - even using DS4Windows to connect my dualshock 4 to my pc. But that gets tiring and inconvenient. It feel once, got a small scuff on the trigger, but it's all good and plays well. Anyways, after some days of gaming, I like this controller a lot - the buttons feel real click and effective. I honestly bought it as a inexpensive test to see if I should use the Xbox Labs to create my own for $80 later on - since the ds4s custom options are limited and look too cheap. Anyways, I'm sold.
customer_reviews.author: MR Y

customer_reviews.title: Not a big Xbox fan but!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: So this was a hard decision I'm a PlayStation but but I was having trouble with the controllers connecting and I was going to use Bluetooth but it has problems with latency issues so I looked at PS4 dongle for PC but they started at 84-100 bucks and I found this deal with a controller and dongle for 83 dollars so new controller and dongle can't beat plus the Xbox controllers are more supported on PC. It will definitely be a learning curve but I will hopefully get used to Xbox controller.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Won't charge after two controllers and batteries. Flawed QA.
customer_reviews.text: Tried two controllers, both brand new. Tried two battery packs, both brand new. All, official Microsoft. No combination worked reliably for a PC gaming controller WITH CHARGING. Charging was EXTREMELY unreliable. Forcing the battery pack harder against the controller magically made it work sometimes... Figured it had to be the controller, replaced it. Nope. Tried replacing the battery pack next. Nope. I'm done. Bought a Dualshock 4 and have had zero issues since purchase. Awful QA and product reliability from the company that makes both products (that are officially supported to work together..).
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Harman

customer_reviews.text: Very heavy more than i expected at first & installing controller on windows 7 64 bit pro a big problem couldn't get the wireless adapter install so i upgraded to Windows 10 64 bit pro and after a huge amounts of time updating Windows 10 finally a few restarts later it worked with the wireless adapter heads up no support for Windows 7, 8 & 8.1 you need Windows 10 to make it work with the wireless adapter before you buy even know it says Windows 7, 8 & 8.1 only 10 is compatible with wireless adapter

customer_reviews.title: Found out it's not needed..
customer_reviews.text: So first off let me say they're is nothing wrong with this product. However after buying it I found out it was unnecessary to have the stick that comes with it. The Xbox controller itself will have bluetooth and so does windows ten. So the stick is totally unnecessary. Just go ahead and buy or use an existing xbox one controller, and connect it with your computer using bluetooth. The only time I think this would be useful is when your computer is outdated and has no bluetooth. However it seems irrelevant as if you buy this your obviously using it for gaming and any computer capable of gaming should have bluetooth.

It comes with a usb cord to plug in if you're out. Easy to set up, works with every game I've tried to play using it, and was actually cheaper than 'mega gamer controllers' I was looking at. If you're looking to upgrade or your previous controller died and you just need one, this is the one you want. It's simply the best I've ever used.

My only ding is that it dosen't come standard with a rechargeable battery pack, which I had to buy separately as I didn't want to be feeding it handfuls of AA alkaline batteries at $10 a pack! For that I subtract one star as Sony's PS 4 Controllers come with a rechargeable battery pack included. But overall, I'm very satisfied with this Controller.

customer_reviews.title: Works with STEAM Gaming.
customer_reviews.text: I have the XBOX one and am used to those controllers. With having a few games on the PC in STEAM that are difficult to play with the keyboard, I was looking for a controller and found this. I read many of the reviews, good and bad and thus far have been very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: David Larson

customer_reviews.title: R and L triggers faulty, required firmware update, not made like they used to be.
customer_reviews.text: It does its job I guess, the right triggers are already going bad. Required an update from factory to work correctly. sometimes unit wont wake up and needs a few button smashes. Positives would be fantastic range, more then other's I have tried and the batteries have yet to be changed from date of delivery and setup. If they fixed the failing buttons and wake issues (mainly fix the buttons) this would be a solid choice and a must have for all PC gamers.
customer_reviews.author: GuyFrom-a-FlatState

customer_reviews.title: Continuous disconnection issues. No battery indicator.
customer_reviews.text: The controller, when working well, works WELL. It's a great controller - ergonomic, nice to use, the buttons, triggers, and joysticks feel great. The downside is that it disconnects at the drop of a hat. This may potentially be due to USB power saving settings on your computer - I'm still working on this, but I would expect that a first party accessory like this when paired with the latest version of Windows would "just work," you know?
customer_reviews.author: Cornelius

customer_reviews.title: Works great just takes a minute to connect for me
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a challenge to get it to register when I’d turn it on to use on my PC but other than that it works great and feels very sturdy. Don’t think it should be as expensive as it is; I think like $30 would be fair.
customer_reviews.author: NA

customer_reviews.title: Awesome controller for a decent price
customer_reviews.text: - nice Xbox controller - made of good quality materials - USB dongle for an easy pair with Bluetooth - takes batters but had a port where you can use a wire too not sure if it works I haven't tried it yet - works on my Alienware console with windows 10 - overall I like it and would recommend this controller
customer_reviews.author: Mkmg09

customer_reviews.title: Illiterate Instruction Manual
customer_reviews.text: The controller works great. Had a lot of trouble setting it up because the instruction manual is only pictures. Had to figure out: There are buttons on the controller, and the Bluetooth stick, that you have to press simultaneously. It doesn't actually say that. Doesn't say anything in the booklet. Annoying and wasted a lot of time to set up. Microsoft needs to invest in people who can write manuals.
customer_reviews.author: Kira Gilson

customer_reviews.title: Wireless broke within three months
customer_reviews.text: I should have returned this the moment it started acting up. I've owned this product for 3 months now and first the wireless would go out spontaneously. Now nothing happens when I press the xbox button. Tried new batteries. Haven't dropped it once. It still works with the cable but I do not recommend this controller.
customer_reviews.author: Bestthinginyears

customer_reviews.title: wireless connector broke
customer_reviews.text: got this for my husband with a gift card I got at work. He was excited to be able to use this controller not only with the Xbox but also with his games on the computer. The connector allowed his and my controller to connect to one and it worked great! until it didn't. it worked for maybe a max of 2 weeks before it stopped and we were back to using a wire to connect the controller to the computer. The Controller itself works great but the use connector (and why he chose this controller) was a disappointment. Giving 3 stars because the controller works.
customer_reviews.author: Mck

customer_reviews.title: aa batteries still?
customer_reviews.text: bought this to replace pc controller from another brand that lasted 8 years. for this price in 2019 it should come with rechargable batteries. the usb cable it comes with is a joke- its not for direct connecting controller to pc, its for connecting usb wireless adaptor to pc...in case you find yourself 3feet out of wireless range, this cable is kinda pointless. also, buttons feel mushy
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Connecting now, which is a plus
customer_reviews.text: Failed to connect to bluetooth. What's a point of a game controller when it doesn't work? Utter garbage, instructions are not accurate and online help is not helpful. Returning tomorrow. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ After some significant time spent working on troubleshooting, the device drivers will not install over a default metered connection. Make sure if you have this turned on you also hit the checkbox for "download over metered connections" in your bluetooth settings (Win 10). Once the firmware downloaded, it connected with few problems.
customer_reviews.author: J. Samuel Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Wow works great and with all games, no drivers needed.
customer_reviews.text: Controller is a good weight and feel, performs great and easy to set up. Comes with a usb cable to lengthen plugin for PC so you can plug in the back of it. It also comes with two duracell AA batteries to get you started. Great buy and such a step up from this wired knockoff nonsense that doesnt work on certain games. Dont worry now, your pc is now a XBOX, even the audio jack plugin sounds pretty decent and opens up alot of options in your ingame overlay. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Hotrod52

customer_reviews.title: Good controller and awesome with the bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: I got this so I could play Steam games on my gaming laptop with an Xbox one controller. Works perfectly and the signal strength is great. Good response time and a pretty decent battery life. Would recommend if want to game on a laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony T.

customer_reviews.title: Typically high-quality
customer_reviews.text: Feels nice, works very well. It is very solid like previous models. Too bad there's absolutely no way in the world to make it work wirelessly with Windows 7 (thank you, Microsoft). Otherwise, I would have given it 5 stars. But, that's a pretty big deal as I have to use a micro usb cable for it to be usable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Controller seems used and some button DON'T work
customer_reviews.text: When unboxing the controller, it was covered in dust, which I wasn't too concerned about. Excited for my "New" controller I plugged it in and started playing FIFA, I instantly noticed that the X and Y buttons were not working. I then went to the device manager to troubleshoot the controller where I noticed that every other button was being registered except for the two previously mentioned. I basically have a controller that is not usable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Input lag from 10 ft away would recommend: can connect multiple controllers.
customer_reviews.text: Small dongle that it came with is better than the dumb Bluetooth dongles ive been using. If you’re gaming 10-15 frs away I think this is the better solution. No input lag with the item. Item was used next to a router with no input lag so it is a solid connection Bonus: you can connect multiple controllers. Tried with 3 and all connected no problems. Played 2 player games no problem: didn’t try 3 player games
customer_reviews.author: carlos

customer_reviews.title: So happy to buy controller w/converter. So fast shipping!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great controller with the wireless converter to have if you have any manual disability challenges. I was using my son's controller because using computer keys to play comp games was too difficult for me. This works great too when I want to use my HDMI cord to link in my tv screen so I won't have to strain my eyes to see the gaming screen. So happy to purchase both of these items together.
customer_reviews.author: Pegasus

customer_reviews.title: The Feel of Quality
customer_reviews.text: Upgrading from a cheaper aftermarket controller to a authentic Xbox controller is like night & day, the feel and precision of the controls is so much better , the weight and balance is perfect , really glad i did it. highly recommend this Controller
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: It does whats stated. I would go for a rechargeable battery thoe because it eats battery's like candy. You could hook up any charging wire and have it that way but if you want true wireless 24/7 get the rechargeable battery with it. It works great thoe and works with all my favorite games on PC and very responsive and customization options.
customer_reviews.author: Westanikam

customer_reviews.title: XBOX ACC Error
customer_reviews.text: When initially setting up the controller I ran into the "XBOX ACC "error in the device manager. I had to Google to find a guide to fix the issue. I downloaded 5 drivers from a Microsoft website and tried them all before one of them was the correct driver for the wireless adapter. This was with a new install of Windows 10. This should have been plug and play, but it could not find the drivers automatically. The controller works fine, but this initial experience has caused me to lower the overall review score.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Schrader

customer_reviews.title: wireless?
customer_reviews.text: I use it wired, because with win 10 it really doesn't seem to work wireless. I tried. I am an IT tech. It doesn't work. I tried the fixes in comments. Zippo. It is great as a wired controller, but maybe just get the wired, as this just does not work.
customer_reviews.author: chrisp339

customer_reviews.title: Decent controller for the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for PC gaming. Not much to say really. It's a gaming controller that you can use for PC gaming. Connected right up and I was gaming in minutes. Responsive and functions like your standard Xbox controller. Only real gripe I have is that you have to constantly replace batteries, but a rechargeable battery pack takes care of that. They really need to do what PS4 does with the whole rechargeable controllers.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Pike

customer_reviews.title: Decent controller, nothing special
customer_reviews.text: The controller frequently disconnects from its signal for no reason which gets really frustrating during game play. Especially considering I use a PC and need a controller. When it is working it works just fine, but it would be much more beneficial if this worked 100% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much just an Xbox Controller for my PC. What could possibly go wrong?
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much just an Xbox Controller for my PC. What could possibly go wrong? Its actually better than Sony's version of this because if you want a PS4 controller with Wireless Receiver, then its about $120 last time i checked. Plus that Receiver is tied to that controller so you cant use any other controller with it. (last time i checked) With this you can use any Xbox controller that you could possibly buy so you can go buy one from Microsoft's own customization thing and it will work with this.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Easy PC connection
customer_reviews.text: Save yourself the headache and buy this controller that came with the adapter. If you like to use your xbox controller on a pc,then the adapter is a must. The adapter made connecting the controller as easy as connecting it to the xbox. Great product
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: No issues,  great deal
customer_reviews.text: Only had it a short time and have used it a lot. So far no issues while gaming havnt had it disconnect or drop In and out of range like some reviews said. Was a nice upgrade from the wired Xbox 360 controller I was using.
customer_reviews.author: craig daly

customer_reviews.title: Refurbished or Returned Controller
customer_reviews.text: Got my controller today and noticed things in the box were rattling around. Opened it up pretty easily as the seal was already cut and found the wireless USB stick was loose in the box. Also found the batteries were already opened and in the controller along with what looks to be dog or cat hair which is definitely not a something you find in a new product. So far everything appears to work but should not be sold as a "new product" by any means. Update 2/22/20 D pad is no longer responding and had to send back for a refund. Will not be buying another from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Finally upgraded from the wired 360 and can't believe I didn't sooner. This controller is so much more comfortable and the vibration mechanism is night and day. I ended up buying a second one for my HTPC living room setup.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate plug-n-play on Win10
customer_reviews.text: This is standard size controller which is too small for my medium size hands. Oh well! Works perfectly with my windows 10 machine. I love the instant on! Very impressed with the responsiveness. Also, no installs, no configuration, no hastle!
customer_reviews.author: Danno

customer_reviews.title: Works well! A little cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Control case feels a little cheap. The plastic likes to slip a little in your hand. All in all great value and has worked for 3 months of daily use and no wear.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Bad Buttons and Analog Stick Drift
customer_reviews.text: Recieved the package and hooked it up easily in 30 seconds. I opened rocket league and the first thing I notice is analog stick drift on both analog sticks. I also have to press X, Y, B and A down with some force for the controller to recognize it. I will be refunding the day I got it and I won't be ordering another one since they all are out of stock and have to wait weeks just to get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Very good controller, with potential driver hiccup
customer_reviews.text: The only issue I had was needing to run windows update after plugging in the usb dongle. Out of the box on the latest version of win10 the dongle wouldn't work because windows couldn't find a driver for it. Running windows update solved this issue, I'm not sure how common this is.
customer_reviews.author: julian

customer_reviews.title: Great price, can’t beat it!
customer_reviews.text: Xbox controllers aren’t the best quality but they are definitely top choice for gaming controllers period especially windows 10. Couldn’t sync at first but it was due to outdated version of windows 10 after I updated bing bang pow synced instantly! Also the price is amazing for both the new gen wireless dongle and the newest model Xbox one controller, this is a perfect gift for a PC gamer who is tired of cords or just wants to kick back and relax while playing some games
customer_reviews.author: Jake Chaboy

customer_reviews.title: Adapter and Controller ceased working after a year and a half
customer_reviews.text: I love xbox controllers and was thrilled when I first got my xbox one controller for my PC. It worked great and had no issues. Now about a year and a half from the date of my purchase, my controller and adapter out of the blue stopped working. My adapter isn't recognized by my PC and has ruined the functionality of the duo.
customer_reviews.author: Troy F.

customer_reviews.title: A really incredible deal
customer_reviews.text: Good controller but what makes this a very good deal is the inclusion of the Win 10 dongle for PC gaming with the Xbox controller. Price makes this a really incredible deal.
customer_reviews.author: Fabio

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: The controller seems really good and connected just fine. The controller does no seem to have any issues with the anoloh sticks. It's a bit better to be honest so you don't trip over any wires.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Hildebrand

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work with Windows 7
customer_reviews.text: No information to tell you, but if you connect a cable directly to the device. Windows 7 will recognize it. Unfortunately. If you unplug the cable and try to use it via blue tooth. It no longer recognizes it. Most expensive wired controller ever. I read you can manually install the drivers from a CAB file, but that had bad side effects to my system, and I had to remove them and start over. Direct connect sees it, but you can't do blue tooth.
customer_reviews.author: Todd R Hercules

customer_reviews.title: Flawless connection, wish the batteries lasted longer though
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a while back for racing games, and its great. It connected flawlessly, and is overall a fairly comfortable controller, although I do like the PS4 controller more, but I have to say, I like it and enjoy using it.
customer_reviews.author: Kite

customer_reviews.title: Excelent/ Edit: broke down after a month
customer_reviews.text: Works great out of the box, cant say any more. Edit: it was working fine but now only about a month or so after I purchased it the left joystick is permanently stuck in the up position. I had to replace my previous controller because of a similar problem before. Shame on Xbox for using such cheap parts in their controllers!
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: Straight-Up Replacement for Xbox 360 PC controller.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a new wireless controller for my desktop PC to succeed an outgoing Xbox 360 type. This one fit the bill. Just plug in the receiver to an available USB port, lock the controller to it and off you go. I was up and running in less than 5 mins. Durability is unknown after a week of ownership but my Xbox 360 controller lasted over 5 years so here's hoping.
customer_reviews.author: Danbo

customer_reviews.title: Shipper lost my package, which is why the 1 star.
customer_reviews.text: My package was lost by UPS that this seller shipped by. I gained my package very late but by luck someone returned it to me. After opening and looking,the controller is great, it fits the hands perfectly and the connection is super fast as expected. Connecting to my PC was super quick when I pressed the button on the USB and the controller and windows installed the software in seconds. I was able to play games with the controller pretty quick!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Nice Price
customer_reviews.text: cheaper than getting just the controller at a retail store, and the adapter was a nice bonus since my computer is a bit old and lacks the bluetooth sync.
customer_reviews.author: J.J. Pelletier

product_meta.title: Microsoft Xbox Wireless Controller + Wireless Adapter for Windows 10
product_meta.description: Play PC games with the Xbox Wireless Controller. With the Xbox Wireless Controller + Wireless Adapter for Windows 10, you can experience the enhanced precision and comfort of the Newly streamlined black Xbox controller on your PC. The New and improved adapter features a 66% smaller design, wireless stereo sound support, and the ability to connect up to eight controllers at once. For use with controller compatible games on Xbox One or PCs and Tablets running Windows 7, 8.1., and 10 with USB 2.0 or USB 3.0. Significant firmware update may be required; ISP fees apply. Please visit xbox one/controller update for update instructions.
feature_bullets: Experience the enhanced comfort and feel of the Xbox Wireless Controller
Stay on target with textured grip
Includes Bluetooth technology for gaming on Windows 10 PCs and tablets
Wireless adapter features a 66 percent smaller design, wireless stereo sound support, and the ability to connect upto eight controllers at once
Compatible With Xbox One X, Xbox One S, Xbox One, Windows 10
